title: Rupert Murdoch says Fox hosts 'endorsed' election claims, court filing says
description: Fox boss Rupert Murdoch said in a deposition under oath that any Fox News executives who knowingly allowed lies to be broadcast on the air “should be reprimanded."

title: Judge overseeing Trump grand jury speaks after foreperson's controversial interviews
description: The judge overseeing the Fulton County, Georgia, grand jury investigating Trump told ABC News on Monday that jurors "can talk about the final report"

title: Youngkin adviser says 2024 race is more than Trump, DeSantis
description: Youngkin's comments not preclude him from jumping into the race, adviser says.

title: West Virginia GOP majority House OKs religious freedom bill
description: West Virginia’s GOP supermajority House of Delegates has passed a bill that would create a test for courts to apply when people challenge government regulations they believe interfere with their religious freedom

title: WATCH:  Northern lights seen above UK
description: People across the U.K. were treated to a spectacular light show as the northern lights danced across the night sky in vivid colors.

title: Ex-Cardinal McCarrick asks court to dismiss sex assault case
description: Lawyer says the 92-year-old has dementia and is not competent to stand trial.

title: Canada bans TikTok on government-issued devices
description: Canada banned TikTok on government-issued mobile devices on Monday over data security concerns, following a similar ban from the European Union last week.

title: Man caught on camera vandalizing mosque
description: Philadelphia police are searching for the suspect who vandalized a mosque this weekend.

title: Judge upholds acquittal in 9 hurricane nursing home deaths
description: A nursing home administrator was charged with the deaths of nine patients.

title: Supreme Court case against Biden student debt relief could hinge on 1 state
description: A group of six GOP-led states challenging the Biden administration's student debt relief plan at the Supreme Court first must answer how, exactly, they are harmed.

title: 'Dilbert,' Scott Adams lose distributor over racist remarks
description: The distributor of the “Dilbert” comic strip says it will sever ties with creator Scott Adams over his recent racist comments

title: Putin bestows friendship award on actor Steven Seagal
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has bestowed a state decoration on Steven Seagal, the American action-movie actor who also holds Russian citizenship

title: Terry Holland, who transformed Virginia basketball, dies
description: Terry Holland, who elevated Virginia basketball to national prominence during 16 seasons as coach, has died

title: Death toll climbs to 62 in migrant smuggling boat wreck on Italian coast
description: At least 62 migrants were killed and more than 81 were rescued Sunday when the wooden smuggling boat they were aboard crashed in southern Italy.

title: Jurors will visit crime scene site in Alex Murdaugh trial
description: The judge has ruled that Jurors in Alex Murdaugh’s murder trial in the shooting deaths of his wife and son will get to visit the South Carolina home where the killings took place before they begin deliberating

title: DeSantis takes over Disney district, punishing company
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis has signed a bill that gives him control of Walt Disney World’s self-governing district, punishing the company over its opposition to the so-called “Don’t Say Gay” law

title: Supreme Court to hear challenge to consumer agency
description: The Supreme Court says it will take up a Republican-led challenge to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, a case that could threaten how the consumer watchdog agency functions if the high court agrees with the challenge

title: WATCH:  Teddy bears thrown onto soccer field for child survivors of Turkey earthquake
description: Thousands of teddy bears and other stuffed animals were thrown onto an Istanbul soccer field as a donation to Turkey's child earthquake survivors.

title: Energy agency: SUV growth weighs on emissions, batteries
description: The International Energy Agency says ever bigger cars pose a growing problem for the environment because they produce more greenhouse gas emissions and need larger batteries than their smaller cousins

title: Tornadoes touch down in Kansas, Oklahoma as massive winter storm moves east
description: At least nine tornadoes were reported in Kansas and Oklahoma on Sunday night as a massive winter storm moves eastward across the country.

title: Betty Boothroyd, first female UK Commons speaker, dies at 93
description: The first female speaker of Britain’s House of Commons has died at age 93

title: Pope to visit Hungary in April, migration and war on agenda
description: Pope Francis will visit Hungary at the end of April

title: Trans people face 'horrifying' rhetoric at statehouses
description: A Little Rock pharmacist's testimony before a legislative committee about gender affirming care for minors resulted in an Arkansas lawmaker asking about her genitalia

title: Japan to ease COVID border measures for travelers from China
description: Japan is easing its coronavirus border measures for tourists from China beginning Wednesday by testing only random passengers

title: Florida judge issues arrest warrant for Kodak Black
description: An arrest warrant has been issued for South Florida rap artist Kodak Black, alleging Black violated the conditions of his pretrial release

title: Ohio train derailment: Federal interagency teams go door-to-door in East Palestine
description: As of Sunday afternoon, the federal interagency teams have had "more than 350 interactions" with East Palestine residents, according to FEMA.

title: New quake hits Turkey, toppling more buildings: 1 killed
description: Officials say a magnitude 5.6 earthquake shook southern Turkey causing some damaged buildings to collapse and killing at least one person

title: China accuses US of 'bullying' with new 'illegal' sanctions
description: China has accused the U.S. of “outright bullying and double standards" in leveling what it called “illegal" sanctions on Chinese companies as part of U.S. actions against Russia’s Wagner Group and related companies and individuals

title: Andrew Tate to appeal third arrest extension in Romania
description: Andrew Tate has arrived at a Romanian appeals court in Bucharest to challenge a court’s decision last week to extend for a third time his detention by 30 days

title: North Korea holds rare meeting on farming amid food shortage
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un opened a major political conference dedicated to agriculture, state media reported Monday, amid outside assessments that suggest the country is facing a serious shortfall of food

title: Strikes hit 2 German airports public workers pay dispute
description: Nearly all flights at Germany’s Cologne-Bonn airport and the majority at nearby Duesseldorf have been canceled or diverted as a result of strikes that also affected local transport, day-care facilities and local administration in Germany’s most populou...

title: Last-minute problem keeps SpaceX rocket, astronauts grounded
description: Last-minute technical trouble forced SpaceX to call off Monday's attempt to launch four astronauts to the International Space Station for NASA

title: WATCH:  Lacrosse team pushes bus out of the mud
description: Members of the Elon University women’s lacrosse squad warmed up for their game by helping to push their bus out of the mud.

title: WATCH:  Bald eagles work together to build nest
description: Two nesting bald eagles worked together to place a stick in the perfect spot.

title: CDC warns of increase of drug-resistant bacteria Shigella
description: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention issued a health advisory on Friday about an increase in the antibiotic-resistant bacteria called Shigella.
